attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening for men aged 50 and over
attributes.additional_details:
Prostate cancer is like many forms of cancer more easily treated / cured if it is caught early. The symptoms however are not always obvious and can easily be thought to be similar to a bladder infection or just a symptom of “getting older”
I myself had only minor symptoms and my health was good overall and delayed taking the matter further until it was clear an infection was not clearing up.
I like many then discovered that a diagnosis of prostate cancer was at more advanced stage and had likely been present for a number of years before presenting.
attributes.background: Make routine PSA checks for prostate cancer as part of the NHS health screening for men in the same manner as smear testing and breast screening for women.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Fund a national screening programme for Prostate Cancer: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/623230

Require men over the age of 50 to be invited for a PSA test: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/615500
